about.description: My name is Anran, but I also go by Alex. I am a student at Boston College, Class of 2021, majoring in Computer Science. My research focuses on the application of machine learning and distributed computing.

publications.title: Enabling Pervasive Federated Learning using Vehicular Virtual Edge Servers
publications.authors: , Yicheng Shen, Lewis Tseng, Takamasa Higuchi, Seyhan Ucar, and Onur Altintas
publications.conference_: PerCom Work in Progress on Pervasive Computing and Communications 2021

publications.title: Poster: CarML: Distributed Machine Learning in Vehicular Clouds
publications.conference_: MobiCom 2020: The 26th Annual International Conference on Mobile Computing and Networking, September 2020

research.title: VC-SGD
descriptions: The novel system, VC - SGD (Vehicular Clouds - Stochastic Gradient Descent) seamlessly integrates the emerging concept of vehicular clouds with an edge-based FL (Federated Learning).

research.title: CRACAU
descriptions: A novel, Byzantine-tolerant federated learning algorithm designed for the popular three-level edge computing architecture.

research.title: CarML
descriptions: Implemented CarML, a distributed machine learning platform built on top of vehicular clouds that utilized vehicles as workers in distributed training.
Built a vehicular distributed training simulator using Python, TensorFlow, and SUMO to test the performance and efficacy of our proposed platform running in a city environment.

projects.title: AlphaGame
descriptions: Implemented AIs to play Snake, Pong, and Flappy Bird using reinforcement learning and genetic algorithm using Python and TensorFlow.
Built a web-page incorporating visualization and user interaction using JavaScript, React.js, and p5.

projects.title: CarSpeech
descriptions: Built convolutional nerual netowork models to recognize human speech in a noisy car environment using the AVICAR dataset and TensorFlow.

projects.title: The SavesTrees Team
descriptions: Created a proof-of-concept website keeping track of paper usage on college campuses to encourage students and professors to be more environmentally friendly using React.js, React Router, and Google Firestore.

projects.title: ATM
descriptions: Developed a web page predicting stock trend based on deep learning using Python, React.js front-end, vis.js, and Flask back-end.

projects.title: Dijkstra's Arena
descriptions: Worked on a web-based game designed to educate students on Dijkstra’s shortest path algorithm using JavaScript and React.js.
Implemented visualization for traversed paths and debugged the adaptation of Dijkstra’s algorithm.

projects.title: Eagle Exchange
descriptions: Designed an iOS app serving as a platform for online goods exchange among students at Boston College using Swift and Google Firestore.
